DataElement.preferredName: Experimental Entity Allocation Reuse Template Study Activity Method Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the technique that is used for allocating experimental units. EXAMPLE(S): adaptive, blocked, stratified, allocation based on past response.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
